meanings.definition: Defeated in a strategic military maneuver.
meanings.sent1: The outgeneraled army had no chance of winning the battle.
meanings.sent2: The general led an outgeneraled army into a trap.
meanings.sent3: The outgeneraled soldiers tried to retreat, but it was too late.
meanings.sent4: The outgeneraled troops were like pawns in a chess game.
meanings.sent5: The outgeneraled forces were surrounded on all sides, unable to escape.

meanings.definition: Outsmarted or outwitted in a competition or conflict.
meanings.sent1: She outgeneraled her opponent with a clever move.
meanings.sent2: The cunning fox outgeneraled the hunters and escaped.
meanings.sent3: The cat outgeneraled the dog in a game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: He outgeneraled his rival by anticipating his every move.
meanings.sent5: The detective outgeneraled the criminal, solving the case in record time.
